title.narrative: ENHANCE QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: 2.4.2 Support roll out of School Improvement, Monitoring and Planning initiative through community and child/adolescent participation in 10 (5 in 2015 5 in 2016) for gradual transformation to Child Friendly School environments., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially adolescents (both boys and girls), families and communities in the most deprived localities are resilient and adopt appropriate practices to reduce their vulnerability.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.4.2 Support roll out of School Improvement, Monitoring and Planning initiative through community and child/adolescentparticipation in 10 (5 in 2015; 5 in 2016) for gradual transformation to Child Friendly School environments.

description.narrative: 17,931 PTA members have been trained with UNICEF support during 2014-2017 to enhance their capacity for development, implementation, financing, and monitoring of school improvement plans to enhance quality and inclusive education using child friendly schools principles. In 2017 1,760 PTA and SIP committee members in 636 schools were trained | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018
